### Technical Excellence
- **Performance optimized** for large-scale repository management
- **Security hardened** with enterprise-grade protection patterns
- **Monitoring enabled** with comprehensive observability and alerting
- **Test covered** with performance, integration, and unit test suites

## üîÑ Integration Points

### ADHDo Server Architecture
- **MCP client patterns** with tool registration and lifecycle management
- **FastAPI routing** with authentication and authorization

- **ADHD optimization** maintaining cognitive load awareness in all operations

Session backend research and architectural decision - Issue #310 Chunk 2

**Backend Selection: Redis** ‚úÖ

**Decision Rationale:**
- Excellent concurrency and thread-safety
- Native TTL support for automatic expiration
- Atomic operations prevent race conditions
- Rich data structures for complex session data
- Memory efficient with bounded usage
- Production-proven for high-scale applications

**Alternatives Evaluated:**
- PostgreSQL: Too heavyweight, complex TTL management
- Enhanced SQLite: Limited concurrency, doesn't solve core issues
- In-Memory + Locks: Quick fix but not production-ready

**Implementation Strategy:**
1. Abstract SessionBackend interface for flexibility
2. Redis primary implementation with async support
3. Fallback strategy for development environments
4. Configuration integration with existing settings system

**Deployment Flexibility:**
- Development: Redis in Docker container
- Staging: Single Redis instance
- Production: Redis Cluster or managed service (ElastiCache)

Next: Design abstract session storage interface

üöÄ Implement comprehensive agent task management system

This represents a complete implementation of an intelligent, emoji-enhanced task management system designed for agent-based workflows with advanced automation and analytics capabilities.

## üéØ Core Implementation Features

- Multi-agent coordination with workload balancing

**Enhanced Logging & Monitoring:**
- Emoji-enhanced logging system for improved UX and accessibility
- Persistent disk logging with rotation and structured formats
- Comprehensive audit trails and performance monitoring
- Three-tier logging (debug, standard, error) with configurable levels

**Intelligent CLI Interface:**
- Rich command-line interface with color-coded output and emoji indicators
- Smart filtering with completed tasks hidden by default
- Comprehensive analytics and reporting capabilities
- Template system for standardized task creation
- Auto-transition system for dependency-based workflow automation

**Validation & Quality Assurance:**
- Robust validation system with configurable rules and limits
- Agent assignment validation with automatic migration suggestions
- Date validation, dependency verification, and business rule enforcement
- Comprehensive system-wide consistency checks

**Advanced Analytics:**
- Agent performance metrics and workload analysis
- Velocity trends and completion rate tracking
- Bottleneck identification and dependency analysis
- Critical path detection and risk assessment

## üìä Technical Metrics
- **109 files**: Complete system implementation

recent_issues.title: üé® Complete Frontend Redesign: Stunning Dark Mode & Clean UX
recent_issues.body:
## üéØ Problem Statement

The current CV frontend has poor accessibility controls and cluttered UI:
- Multiple theme toggles and buttons scattered everywhere
- Poor dark mode implementation with accessibility issues  
- Overwhelming interface with too many controls
- Inconsistent styling and visual hierarchy
- Bad user experience on mobile and desktop

## üé® Vision: Stunning Dark Mode CV

Create a **single, beautiful dark mode design** that is:
- ‚ú® **Visually Stunning**: Premium dark theme with excellent contrast
- üéØ **Clean & Minimal**: Remove clutter, focus on content
- ‚ôø **Accessibility First**: WCAG 2.1 AA compliant by default
- üì± **Mobile Perfect**: Touch-optimized responsive design
- ‚ö° **Performance**: Fast loading, smooth animations

## üõ† Technical Requirements

### Design System
- Single dark mode theme (remove light mode toggle chaos)
- Consistent color palette with excellent contrast ratios
- Clean typography hierarchy
- Subtle animations and micro-interactions
- Professional spacing and layout grid

### UX Improvements  
- Remove unnecessary buttons and controls
- Clear visual hierarchy for content sections
- Intuitive navigation without clutter
- Touch-friendly mobile interface
- Loading states and smooth transitions

### Accessibility
- WCAG 2.1 AA compliance throughout
- Proper semantic HTML structure
- Keyboard navigation support
- Screen reader optimization
- High contrast ratios (4.5:1 minimum)

## üîß Implementation Strategy

Deploy specialized agents in parallel:
- **Interface Artisan**: Lead UX/UI design and implementation
- **Data Flow Architect**: Optimize content delivery and performance  
- **Data Architect**: Structure data for clean presentation

## ‚úÖ Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Single stunning dark mode theme
- [ ] Removed all unnecessary UI elements
- [ ] WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility compliance
- [ ] Mobile-first responsive design
- [ ] Improved loading performance
- [ ] Clean, professional visual hierarchy
- [ ] Smooth animations and transitions
- [ ] Touch-optimized interface elements

## üéØ Priority: P0 - Complete Frontend Overhaul

Transform the CV from cluttered interface to stunning professional showcase.

recent_issues.title: chore(deps-dev): bump astro from 5.11.1 to 5.12.8

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: Pull requests that update javascript code

recent_issues.body:
Bumps [astro](https://github.com/withastro/astro/tree/HEAD/packages/astro) from 5.11.1 to 5.12.8.
Release notes

Sourced from astro's releases.

astro@5.12.8

Patch Changes

  • 0567fb7 Thanks @‚Äãascorbic! - Adds // to list of internal path prefixes that do not have automated trailing slash handling

  • #13894 b36e72f Thanks @‚Äãflorian-lefebvre! - Removes Astro Studio commands from the CLI help

  • Updated dependencies [0567fb7]:

    • @‚Äãastrojs/internal-helpers@‚Äã0.7.1
    • @‚Äãastrojs/markdown-remark@‚Äã6.3.5

astro@5.12.7

Patch Changes

  • #14169 f4e8889 Thanks @‚Äãascorbic! - Skips trailing slash handling for paths that start with /..

  • #14170 34e6b3a Thanks @‚Äãematipico! - Fixes an issue where static redirects couldn't correctly generate a redirect when the destination is a prerendered route, and the output is set to "server".

  • #14169 f4e8889 Thanks @‚Äãascorbic! - Fixes a bug that prevented images from being displayed in dev when using the Netlify adapter with trailingSlash set to always

  • Updated dependencies [f4e8889]:

    • @‚Äãastrojs/internal-helpers@‚Äã0.7.0
    • @‚Äãastrojs/markdown-remark@‚Äã6.3.4

astro@5.12.6

Patch Changes

  • #14153 29e9283 Thanks @‚Äãjp-knj! - Fixes a regression introduced by a recent optimisation of how SVG images are emitted during the build.

  • #14156 592f08d Thanks @‚ÄãTheOtterlord! - Fix the client router not submitting forms if the active URL contained a hash

  • #14160 d2e25c6 Thanks @‚Äãascorbic! - Fixes a bug that meant some remote image URLs could cause invalid filenames to be used for processed images

  • #14167 62bd071 Thanks @‚Äãascorbic! - Fixes a bug that prevented destroyed sessions from being deleted from storage unless the session had been loaded

astro@5.12.5

Patch Changes

  • #14059 19f53eb Thanks @‚Äãbenosmac! - Fixes a bug in i18n implementation, where Astro didn't emit the correct pages when fallback is enabled, and a locale uses a catch-all route, e.g. src/pages/es/[...catchAll].astro

  • #14155 31822c3 Thanks @‚Äãascorbic! - Fixes a bug that caused an error "serverEntrypointModule[_start] is not a function" in some adapters

astro@5.12.4

Patch Changes

recent_issues.title: Implement Playwright Browser Automation for Modern Web Scraping
recent_issues.body:
## Enhancement Request
Implement browser automation using Playwright to overcome anti-bot protections and JavaScript-heavy sites that are blocking our current httpx-based scraping.

## Background
Current scraping uses basic HTTP requests that fail on 62% of sources due to:
- Cloudflare protection
- JavaScript-rendered content
- User-agent filtering
- Bot detection systems

## Solution
We already have `enhanced_web_scraper.py` with Playwright integration - we need to:

1. **Enable Playwright by Default**
   - Install Playwright browsers: `playwright install`
   - Set `use_enhanced_scraper=True` by default
   - Add browser automation fallback

2. **Implement Smart Scraping Strategy**
   ```python
   # Try basic HTTP first (fast)
   if basic_scraping_fails():
       # Fallback to browser automation (slower but reliable)
       use_playwright_scraper()
   ```

3. **Add Stealth Features**
   - Random user agents
   - Variable delays between requests
   - Headless browser with real browser signatures

## Expected Impact
- Increase success rate from 38% to 80%+
- Access tourism sites (TripAdvisor, etc.)
- Scrape business directories (Yellow Pages, TrueLocal)
- Handle JavaScript-heavy sites

## Implementation Files
- ‚úÖ `enhanced_web_scraper.py` (exists)
- üìù Update `data_scraper.py` fallback logic
- üìù Add browser installation to setup scripts

## Priority
**Medium-High** - Will significantly improve data collection quality

## Labels
- enhancement  
- scraping
- playwright

recent_issues.title: Low Entity Extraction Quality: 30-70% Confidence Scores
recent_issues.body:
## Problem
Extracted business entities have poor quality with confidence scores of only 30-70%, indicating unreliable data extraction.

## Current State
**6 Entities Extracted:**
1. Huon Valley Medical Services (30% confidence)
2. Business Support Services (30% confidence)  
3. Small Business Tools (30% confidence)
4. Business Directory Search (30% confidence)
5. Google Maps Search Results (60% confidence)
6. Facebook Business Pages (70% confidence)

## Issues
1. **Generic/Vague Names**: \"Services Facilities Halls and Venues\" instead of specific business names
2. **Missing Contact Info**: Most entities have empty contact_info: {}
3. **No Services Listed**: All entities show empty services: []
4. **Poor Location Data**: Most have empty location: {}
5. **Low AI Confidence**: 4/6 entities at minimum 30% confidence

## Root Causes
- Content extraction getting page navigation/headers instead of business data
- AI parsing not optimized for business entity identification
- No structured data extraction (schema.org, JSON-LD)
- Generic scraping not tailored to source types

## Impact
- Unusable business intelligence data
- Cannot provide reliable business recommendations
- Validation pipeline has no quality data to process

## Proposed Solutions
1. **Improve Content Extraction**
   - Target business-specific selectors
   - Extract structured data (JSON-LD, microdata)
   - Filter out navigation/header content

2. **Enhanced AI Prompts**
   - Business-specific extraction prompts
   - Require contact info validation
   - Demand specific business names/services

3. **Source-Specific Scrapers**
   - Custom logic for Yellow Pages, Google Maps
   - Different extraction for government vs commercial sites

## Priority
**High** - Poor data quality makes the entire system unreliable

- bug
- data-quality  
- llm
- extraction

recent_issues.title: Performance Optimization: Slow Social Media Scraping (18+ seconds)
recent_issues.body:
## Performance Issue
Facebook/social media scraping is taking 18+ seconds per source while government sites complete in ~5 seconds, creating bottlenecks in the intelligence cycle.

## Current Performance
**Fast Sources (5-8 seconds):**
- Government sites: Business Tasmania (5.94s), Huon Valley Council (5.20s)
- Google Maps: 14-16s (acceptable)

**Slow Sources (18+ seconds):**
- Facebook business searches: 18.07s - 18.97s
- 3-4x slower than government sites
- Same entity extraction rate (1 entity each)

## Impact
- Intelligence cycle takes 53.7s (could be much faster)
- Social media blocking efficient batch processing  
- User experience degradation during discovery

## Root Causes
1. **Complex Page Loading**: Facebook requires extensive JS rendering
2. **Anti-bot Delays**: Social media sites impose longer loading times
3. **Content Complexity**: More complex DOM structure parsing
4. **Network Overhead**: Multiple redirects and API calls

## Optimization Opportunities
1. **Parallel Processing**: Process social media sources separately
2. **Intelligent Timeouts**: Set shorter timeouts for social media
3. **Caching Strategy**: Cache social media results longer
4. **Selective Scraping**: Only scrape social media if other sources fail
5. **Background Processing**: Move slow sources to background queue

## Success Criteria  
- Social media scraping under 10 seconds
- Overall cycle time under 30 seconds
- Maintain 100% social media success rate

## Priority
**Medium** - Performance optimization for better user experience

## Labels
- performance
- social-media
- optimization
- scraping

recent_issues.title: Add Comprehensive Error Handling & Retry Logic for Failed Sources
recent_issues.body:
## Enhancement Request
Implement intelligent retry mechanisms and comprehensive error handling to recover from transient failures and improve overall scraping reliability.

## Current State
- 16/26 sources failing with generic \"Failed to fetch page content with httpx\"
- No retry logic for transient failures
- No differentiation between permanent vs temporary failures
- All failures treated the same way

## Proposed Enhancements

### 1. Intelligent Retry Logic
```python
retry_strategy = {
    'max_retries': 3,
    'backoff_factor': 2,  # 1s, 2s, 4s delays
    'retry_on': ['timeout', 'connection_error', 'http_5xx']
}
```

### 2. Error Classification
- **Temporary**: Network timeouts, 5xx errors, connection refused
- **Rate Limited**: 429 errors, specific rate limit responses  
- **Blocked**: 403, bot detection patterns
- **Permanent**: 404, certificate errors, malformed URLs

### 3. Adaptive Strategies
- **Rate Limited**: Exponential backoff + longer delays
- **Blocked**: Switch to browser automation 
- **Network Issues**: Retry with different user agents
- **JS Required**: Auto-fallback to Playwright

### 4. Enhanced Error Reporting
```python
{
    'error_type': 'rate_limited|blocked|network|permanent',
    'retry_count': 2,
    'last_attempt': '2025-08-07T10:00:00Z',
    'next_retry': '2025-08-07T10:05:00Z',
    'strategy_used': 'exponential_backoff'
}
```

### 5. Source Health Tracking  
- Track failure patterns per source
- Mark persistently failing sources as \"unhealthy\"  
- Suggest alternative sources for unhealthy ones

## Expected Impact
- Increase success rate from 38% to 60%+
- Better handling of intermittent network issues
- Reduced false failures from temporary problems
- More actionable error information

## Implementation Priority
**Medium-High** - Will significantly improve reliability

## Labels  
- enhancement
- error-handling
- scraping
- reliability

recent_issues.title: Implement Advanced Anti-Bot Evasion Strategies
recent_issues.body:
## Enhancement Request  
Implement comprehensive anti-bot evasion strategies based on modern web scraping best practices to overcome sophisticated detection systems blocking our scrapers.

## Current Problem
Our basic httpx-based scraping is failing against 62% of sources due to modern anti-bot protection systems that analyze multiple detection vectors simultaneously.

## Advanced Detection Systems We're Facing
Based on the sophisticated playbook document in our repo, modern sites use:

### 1. **Browser Fingerprinting**
- JavaScript-based detection (navigator.webdriver, Canvas fingerprinting, WebGL analysis)
- Audio fingerprinting via Web Audio API  
- Browser plugin and font enumeration
- Screen resolution and timezone analysis

### 2. **Protocol-Level Detection**
- TLS fingerprinting (JA3/JA4 signatures)
- HTTP/2 connection patterns
- Network stack signatures that identify Python libraries vs real browsers

### 3. **Behavioral Analysis** 
- Mouse movement patterns (linear vs natural curves)
- Click timing patterns (instant vs human delays)
- Typing cadence and error patterns
- Scroll behavior analysis

### 4. **Network-Level Blocking**
- Data center IP detection (GitHub Actions runners)  
- Rate limiting per IP address
- CAPTCHA challenges for suspicious behavior

## Comprehensive Evasion Strategy

### Phase 1: Browser Automation Enhancement
```python
# Use Playwright with stealth patches
from playwright.async_api import async_playwright
from playwright_stealth import stealth_async

async def create_stealth_browser():
    browser = await playwright.chromium.launch(
        headless=True,
        args=[
            '--no-sandbox',
            '--disable-dev-shm-usage', 
            '--disable-blink-features=AutomationControlled'
        ]
    )
    page = await browser.new_page()
    await stealth_async(page)  # Patch automation indicators
    return page
```

### Phase 2: Human Behavior Emulation
```python
# Natural mouse movements with curves and jitter
import random
import numpy as np

async def human_click(page, selector):
    element = await page.query_selector(selector)
    box = await element.bounding_box()
    
    # Add random offset within element
    x = box['x'] + random.uniform(0.2, 0.8) * box['width']  
    y = box['y'] + random.uniform(0.2, 0.8) * box['height']
    
    # Move mouse in curved path with jitter
    await page.mouse.move(x, y)
    await asyncio.sleep(random.uniform(0.05, 0.15))  # Human reaction time
    await page.mouse.click(x, y)
```

### Phase 3: Residential Proxy Integration
```python
# Route traffic through residential proxies
proxy_config = {
    'server': 'http://residential-proxy-pool:8080',
    'username': 'user',
    'password': 'pass'  
}

browser = await playwright.chromium.launch(proxy=proxy_config)
```

### Phase 4: Request Fingerprint Masking
- Real browser User-Agent rotation
- Consistent header fingerprints  
- TLS signature matching
- HTTP/2 frame order replication

## Implementation Plan

### 1. **Install Advanced Dependencies**
```bash
pip install playwright-stealth
pip install fake-useragent
pip install undetected-playwright
playwright install chromium
```

### 2. **Update DataScraper Architecture**
- Replace httpx with Playwright by default
- Add stealth mode configuration  
- Implement human behavior patterns
- Add proxy rotation support

### 3. **Source-Specific Strategies**
- **Yellow Pages/TrueLocal**: Residential proxies + stealth browser
- **Social Media**: Behavioral emulation + session management
- **Tourism Sites**: Canvas fingerprint masking

## Expected Impact
- Increase success rate from 38% to 80%+
- Access previously blocked high-value sources
- Reduce CAPTCHA triggers to near-zero
- Maintain long-term scraping sustainability

## Security Considerations
- All techniques are defensive/research purposes only
- Respect robots.txt and rate limits
- No malicious exploitation of security systems

## Priority
**High** - Critical for accessing blocked business intelligence sources

## References
- Advanced scraping playbook in repo: `A Developer's Playbook for Resilient Web Scraping...md`

## Labels
- enhancement
- stealth
- anti-bot
- playwright
- security

recent_issues.title: üîß Advanced CI/CD Pipeline Integration - Intelligent Monorepo Workflows
recent_issues.body:
## üìã Overview
Implement enterprise-grade CI/CD infrastructure leveraging advanced patterns from our existing repositories, optimized for Nx monorepo architecture with intelligent change detection and parallel execution.

## üéØ Objectives
- Reduce build times by 75% through intelligent caching and parallelization
- Achieve 99.9% pipeline reliability with automatic retry mechanisms
- Implement zero-downtime deployments across all platforms
- Enable feature flag-driven progressive rollouts
- Establish comprehensive security scanning and compliance validation

## üèóÔ∏è Technical Implementation

### Core Pipeline Architecture
```yaml
# .github/workflows/main.yml
name: Orchestrix Platform CI/CD

on:
  push:
    branches: [main, develop, release/*]
  pull_request:
    types: [opened, synchronize, reopened]

jobs:
  detect-changes:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    outputs:
      affected-projects: ${{ steps.affected.outputs.projects }}
      affected-libs: ${{ steps.affected.outputs.libs }}
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0
      
      - name: Nx Affected Analysis
        id: affected
        run: |
          npx nx affected:apps --base=origin/main
          npx nx affected:libs --base=origin/main

  parallel-validation:
    needs: detect-changes
    strategy:
      matrix:
        project: ${{ fromJson(needs.detect-changes.outputs.affected-projects) }}
      fail-fast: false
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Lint
        run: npx nx lint ${{ matrix.project }}
      
      - name: Type Check
        run: npx nx typecheck ${{ matrix.project }}
      
      - name: Unit Tests
        run: npx nx test ${{ matrix.project }} --coverage
      
      - name: Integration Tests
        run: npx nx test:integration ${{ matrix.project }}

  security-scanning:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Dependency Audit
        run: |
          npm audit --audit-level=moderate
          pip-audit --fix --desc
      
      - name: SAST Analysis
        uses: github/super-linter@v5
      
      - name: Secret Scanning
        uses: trufflesecurity/trufflehog@main
      
      - name: Container Scanning
        run: trivy image --severity HIGH,CRITICAL

  performance-testing:
    needs: parallel-validation
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Lighthouse CI
        run: npx lhci autorun
      
      - name: Bundle Analysis
        run: npx nx build --stats-json
      
      - name: Load Testing
        run: k6 run scripts/load-test.js
```

### Intelligent Caching Strategy
```typescript
// nx.json
{
  "tasksRunnerOptions": {
    "default": {
      "runner": "@nrwl/nx-cloud",
      "options": {
        "accessToken": "{{NX_CLOUD_ACCESS_TOKEN}}",
        "cacheableOperations": [
          "build", "test", "lint", "e2e", "build-storybook"
        ],
        "parallel": 4,
        "cacheDirectory": "/tmp/nx-cache",
        "remoteCache": {
          "enabled": true,
          "url": "s3://orchestrix-nx-cache"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

### Multi-Environment Deployment
```yaml
# Deployment Matrix
environments:
  - name: development
    trigger: push to develop
    approval: automatic
    rollback: automatic
    
  - name: staging
    trigger: push to release/*
    approval: automatic
    rollback: manual
    
  - name: production
    trigger: tag v*
    approval: manual (2 approvers)
    rollback: automatic with alerts
```

## üöÄ Advanced Features

### 1. Intelligent Change Detection
- Path-based filtering for targeted builds
- Dependency graph analysis for affected projects
- Smart test selection based on code changes
- Automatic skip for documentation-only changes

### 2. Parallel Execution Strategy
- Matrix builds for multiple Node versions
- Concurrent testing across projects
- Distributed builds using Nx Cloud
- Dynamic resource allocation based on queue depth

### 3. Progressive Deployment
- Canary deployments with automatic rollback
- Blue-green deployments for zero downtime
- Feature flag integration with LaunchDarkly
- A/B testing framework integration

### 4. Comprehensive Testing
- Unit tests with >80% coverage requirement
- Integration tests for API endpoints
- E2E tests with Playwright
- Performance regression testing
- Security vulnerability scanning
- Accessibility testing

### 5. Artifact Management
```yaml
artifacts:
  - type: docker-images
    registry: ghcr.io/orchestrix
    retention: 30 days (dev), 90 days (prod)
    
  - type: npm-packages
    registry: npm.pkg.github.com
    versioning: semantic
    
  - type: test-results
    storage: s3://orchestrix-artifacts
    format: junit, coverage-lcov
    
  - type: performance-reports
    storage: elasticsearch
    retention: 1 year
```

## üìä Monitoring & Observability

### Pipeline Metrics Dashboard
```typescript
metrics: {
  buildTime: {
    target: "< 5 minutes",
    p95: "< 8 minutes",
    alert: "> 10 minutes"
  },
  testCoverage: {
    minimum: 80,
    target: 85,
    enforcement: "blocking"
  },
  deploymentFrequency: {
    target: "multiple per day",
    tracking: "per-service"
  },
  leadTime: {
    target: "< 2 hours",
    measurement: "commit to production"
  },
  mttr: {
    target: "< 30 minutes",
    automation: "auto-rollback"
  }
}
```

## üîí Security Integration

### Compliance Validation
- HIPAA compliance checks for healthcare modules
- GDPR validation for data handling
- SOC 2 audit trail generation
- PCI DSS for payment processing

### Supply Chain Security
- SBOM generation for all releases
- Dependency license validation
- Reproducible builds verification
- Signed commits enforcement

## üí∞ Cost Optimization
- **Current CI/CD Costs**: $5,000/month
- **Projected Costs**: $2,000/month
- **Savings**: 60% reduction through:
  - Intelligent caching (30% reduction)
  - Parallel execution (20% reduction)
  - Resource optimization (10% reduction)

## üìà Success Metrics
- [ ] Build time < 5 minutes for 95% of builds
- [ ] Zero failed deployments due to pipeline issues
- [ ] 100% of production deployments with rollback capability
- [ ] < 1% flaky test rate
- [ ] 99.9% pipeline availability

## üîß Implementation Tasks
1. [ ] Set up Nx Cloud workspace
2. [ ] Configure GitHub Actions workflows
3. [ ] Implement intelligent change detection
4. [ ] Set up parallel test execution
5. [ ] Configure security scanning tools
6. [ ] Implement progressive deployment
7. [ ] Set up monitoring dashboards
8. [ ] Create rollback procedures
9. [ ] Document CI/CD processes
10. [ ] Train team on new workflows

## üë• Assignment
- **Technical Lead**: DevOps team
- **Security Review**: @adrianwedd
- **Implementation**: Platform engineering team

## üè∑Ô∏è Labels
- ci-cd
- infrastructure
- automation
- performance
- security

## üìÖ Timeline
**Duration**: 4 weeks
**Priority**: Critical
**Dependencies**: Nx monorepo setup (#38)

## üîÑ Agent Interaction Protocols

### Communication Framework
```typescript
class AgentCommunicationProtocol {
  // Synchronous communication
  async requestResponse(
    from: Agent,
    to: Agent,
    message: Message,
    timeout: number = 5000
  ): Promise<Response>;
  
  // Asynchronous messaging
  async broadcast(
    from: Agent,
    category: AgentCategory,
    message: Message
  ): Promise<void>;
  
  // Event-driven coordination
  subscribe(
    agent: Agent,
    event: EventType,
    handler: EventHandler
  ): Subscription;
  
  // Consensus building
  async buildConsensus(
    agents: Agent[],
    proposal: Proposal,
    threshold: number = 0.75
  ): Promise<Consensus>;
}
```

- **Government**: FedRAMP, StateRAMP, FISMA

### Security Architecture
- End-to-end encryption
- Zero-trust architecture
- Multi-factor authentication
- Role-based access control
- Audit logging and monitoring
- Data residency compliance

## üö¶ Risk Analysis
- **Integration Complexity**: Mitigated through phased approach
- **Regulatory Risk**: Addressed through compliance-first design
- **Market Adoption**: Reduced through vertical-specific entry points
- **Technical Debt**: Managed through modern architecture
- **Competition**: Defended through unique cross-vertical capabilities

## üìà 5-Year Vision
- **Year 1**: 3 verticals integrated, $10M ARR
- **Year 2**: 5 verticals, $50M ARR, 100 enterprises
- **Year 3**: 8 verticals, $150M ARR, international expansion
- **Year 4**: Platform ecosystem, $300M ARR, IPO preparation
- **Year 5**: Market leader, $500M+ ARR, strategic acquisitions

## üë• Leadership Assignment
- **Strategic Owner**: @adrianwedd
- **Healthcare Lead**: Medical AI specialist needed
- **Legal Lead**: Legal tech expert needed
- **Integration Architect**: Senior architect needed
- **Compliance Officer**: Regulatory expert needed

## üè∑Ô∏è Labels
- vertical-integration
- strategic-initiative
- revenue-critical
- board-visibility
- competitive-advantage

## üìÖ Timeline
**Start Date**: Parallel with monorepo migration
**Duration**: 20 weeks
**Go-to-Market**: Q2 2025
**Full Platform Launch**: Q3 2025

recent_issues.title: ‚ò∏Ô∏è Enterprise Kubernetes Infrastructure - Multi-Tenant Platform Architecture
recent_issues.body:
## üéØ Objective
Design and implement enterprise-grade Kubernetes infrastructure supporting multi-tenant architecture, auto-scaling, high availability, and cost optimization for the unified AI orchestration platform.

## üíº Business Impact
- **Cost Reduction**: 60% infrastructure cost savings through efficient resource utilization
- **Scalability**: Support 10,000+ concurrent users with sub-second response times
- **Reliability**: 99.99% uptime SLA for enterprise customers
- **Security**: Zero-trust architecture with complete tenant isolation
- **Time to Market**: 75% faster deployment of new features

## üèóÔ∏è Architecture Design

### Cluster Topology
```yaml
clusters:
  production:
    regions:
      - us-east-1:  # Primary
          nodes: 20-100 (auto-scaling)
          zones: [us-east-1a, us-east-1b, us-east-1c]
      - us-west-2:  # Secondary
          nodes: 10-50 (auto-scaling)
          zones: [us-west-2a, us-west-2b]
      - eu-west-1:  # GDPR compliance
          nodes: 10-50 (auto-scaling)
          zones: [eu-west-1a, eu-west-1b]
      - ap-southeast-2:  # APAC/Australia
          nodes: 5-25 (auto-scaling)
          zones: [ap-southeast-2a, ap-southeast-2b]
    
  staging:
    regions:
      - us-east-1:
          nodes: 5-20 (auto-scaling)
    
  development:
    regions:
      - us-east-1:
          nodes: 3-10 (auto-scaling)
```

### Multi-Tenant Architecture
```typescript
interface TenantConfiguration {
  tenant: {
    id: string;
    tier: 'starter' | 'professional' | 'enterprise';
    isolation: 'namespace' | 'node' | 'cluster';
  };
  
  resources: {
    cpu: {
      request: string;  // "2"
      limit: string;    // "8"
    };
    memory: {
      request: string;  // "4Gi"
      limit: string;    // "16Gi"
    };
    storage: {
      persistent: string;  // "100Gi"
      ephemeral: string;   // "50Gi"
    };
  };
  
  networking: {
    ingress: {
      class: 'nginx' | 'istio';
      tls: boolean;
      waf: boolean;
    };
    egress: {
      allowed: string[];
      denied: string[];
    };
    serviceMesh: {
      enabled: boolean;
      mtls: boolean;
    };
  };
  
  security: {
    podSecurityPolicy: 'restricted' | 'baseline';
    networkPolicy: boolean;
    secretsManagement: 'vault' | 'sealed-secrets';
    encryption: {
      atRest: boolean;
      inTransit: boolean;
    };
  };
}
```

### Service Mesh Architecture (Istio)
```yaml
apiVersion: networking.istio.io/v1beta1
kind: VirtualService
metadata:
  name: orchestrix-platform
spec:
  hosts:
  - orchestrix.ai
  http:
  - match:
    - headers:
        tenant-id:
          exact: healthcare
    route:
    - destination:
        host: dx0-service
        subset: v2
      weight: 20  # Canary deployment
    - destination:
        host: dx0-service
        subset: v1
      weight: 80
  - match:
    - headers:
        tenant-id:
          exact: legal
    route:
    - destination:
        host: veritas-service
```

## üöÄ Infrastructure Components

### 1. Core Platform Services
```yaml
# Ingress Controller (NGINX/Istio Gateway)
ingress:
  replicas: 3
  autoscaling:
    min: 3
    max: 10
    targetCPU: 70%
  resources:
    requests:
      cpu: 500m
      memory: 512Mi
    limits:
      cpu: 2000m
      memory: 2Gi

# API Gateway (Kong/Envoy)
api-gateway:
  replicas: 5
  cache:
    enabled: true
    ttl: 300
  rateLimit:
    enabled: true
    requests: 1000/minute
  
# Message Queue (RabbitMQ/Kafka)
messaging:
  kafka:
    brokers: 5
    partitions: 50
    replication: 3
  rabbitmq:
    nodes: 3
    queues: 100
    durability: true
```

### 2. Data Layer
```yaml
# PostgreSQL (Primary Database)
postgresql:
  architecture: replication
  primary:
    replicas: 1
    persistence:
      size: 500Gi
      storageClass: ssd-ultra
  readReplicas:
    replicas: 3
    persistence:
      size: 500Gi
  pgBouncer:
    enabled: true
    poolSize: 100

# Redis (Caching & Sessions)
redis:
  architecture: replication
  sentinel:
    enabled: true
    replicas: 3
  master:
    persistence:
      enabled: true
      size: 50Gi
  replica:
    replicas: 2

# Elasticsearch (Search & Analytics)
elasticsearch:
  master:
    replicas: 3
    persistence:
      size: 50Gi
  data:
    replicas: 5
    persistence:
      size: 1Ti
  coordinating:
    replicas: 2
```

### 3. Observability Stack
```yaml
# Prometheus + Grafana
monitoring:
  prometheus:
    retention: 30d
    storage: 500Gi
    scrapeInterval: 15s
    replicas: 2
  grafana:
    replicas: 2
    dashboards:
      - platform-overview
      - tenant-metrics
      - agent-performance
      - cost-analysis
  alertmanager:
    replicas: 3
    receivers:
      - pagerduty
      - slack
      - email

# Logging (ELK/EFK Stack)
logging:
  fluentd:
    daemonset: true
    buffers: 1Gi
  elasticsearch:
    retention: 7d
    shards: 5
    replicas: 2
  kibana:
    replicas: 2

# Distributed Tracing (Jaeger)
tracing:
  collector:
    replicas: 3
    sampling: 0.1
  storage:
    type: elasticsearch
    retention: 7d
```

### 4. Security & Compliance
```yaml
# HashiCorp Vault
vault:
  mode: ha
  replicas: 3
  storage:
    type: consul
    size: 10Gi
  audit:
    enabled: true
    path: /vault/audit
  
# OPA (Policy Enforcement)
opa:
  replicas: 3
  policies:
    - tenant-isolation
    - resource-limits
    - network-segmentation
    - data-classification

# Falco (Runtime Security)
falco:
  enabled: true
  rules:
    - suspicious-processes
    - file-integrity
    - network-anomalies
  alerts:
    slack: true
    pagerduty: true
```

## üìä Auto-Scaling Configuration

### Horizontal Pod Autoscaling
```yaml
apiVersion: autoscaling/v2
kind: HorizontalPodAutoscaler
metadata:
  name: orchestrix-api
spec:
  scaleTargetRef:
    apiVersion: apps/v1
    kind: Deployment
    name: orchestrix-api
  minReplicas: 5
  maxReplicas: 100
  metrics:
  - type: Resource
    resource:
      name: cpu
      target:
        type: Utilization
        averageUtilization: 70
  - type: Resource
    resource:
      name: memory
      target:
        type: Utilization
        averageUtilization: 80
  - type: Pods
    pods:
      metric:
        name: http_requests_per_second
      target:
        type: AverageValue
        averageValue: "1000"
  behavior:
    scaleDown:
      stabilizationWindowSeconds: 300
      policies:
      - type: Percent
        value: 50
        periodSeconds: 60
    scaleUp:
      stabilizationWindowSeconds: 60
      policies:
      - type: Percent
        value: 100
        periodSeconds: 30
```

### Vertical Pod Autoscaling
```yaml
apiVersion: autoscaling.k8s.io/v1
kind: VerticalPodAutoscaler
metadata:
  name: orchestrix-agents
spec:
  targetRef:
    apiVersion: apps/v1
    kind: Deployment
    name: agent-runtime
  updatePolicy:
    updateMode: "Auto"
  resourcePolicy:
    containerPolicies:
    - containerName: agent-container
      minAllowed:
        cpu: 100m
        memory: 128Mi
      maxAllowed:
        cpu: 2
        memory: 2Gi
```

### Cluster Autoscaling
```yaml
cluster-autoscaler:
  nodeGroups:
    - name: general-purpose
      minSize: 3
      maxSize: 50
      instanceTypes: [t3.large, t3.xlarge]
    - name: compute-optimized
      minSize: 0
      maxSize: 20
      instanceTypes: [c5.2xlarge, c5.4xlarge]
      taints:
        - key: workload-type
          value: compute-intensive
    - name: memory-optimized
      minSize: 0
      maxSize: 10
      instanceTypes: [r5.2xlarge, r5.4xlarge]
      taints:
        - key: workload-type
          value: memory-intensive
```

## üí∞ Cost Optimization

### Resource Optimization
- **Spot Instances**: 70% of non-critical workloads
- **Reserved Instances**: 3-year commitment for baseline capacity
- **Right-sizing**: VPA for optimal resource allocation
- **Bin Packing**: Efficient pod placement algorithms
- **Idle Resource Detection**: Automatic scale-down during off-hours

### Cost Monitoring
```yaml
kubecost:
  enabled: true
  alerts:
    - name: namespace-budget-exceeded
      threshold: $1000/month
    - name: idle-resources
      threshold: 20%
    - name: over-provisioned
      threshold: 30%
  recommendations:
    enabled: true
    frequency: weekly
```

## üîí Disaster Recovery

### Backup Strategy
```yaml
velero:
  enabled: true
  schedule:
    full-backup:
      schedule: "0 2 * * *"  # Daily at 2 AM
      ttl: 720h  # 30 days
    incremental:
      schedule: "0 */6 * * *"  # Every 6 hours
      ttl: 168h  # 7 days
  storage:
    provider: aws
    bucket: orchestrix-backups
    region: us-east-1
```

### Multi-Region Failover
- **RPO**: < 1 hour
- **RTO**: < 15 minutes
- **Automated failover**: Health check based
- **Data replication**: Cross-region async replication
- **DNS failover**: Route53 health checks

## üìà Performance Targets
- **API Response Time**: p50 < 100ms, p99 < 500ms
- **Throughput**: 100,000 requests/second
- **Availability**: 99.99% uptime
- **Deployment Frequency**: 50+ deployments/day
- **MTTR**: < 15 minutes

## üîß Implementation Tasks
1. [ ] Set up multi-region Kubernetes clusters
2. [ ] Implement service mesh with Istio
3. [ ] Configure multi-tenant isolation
4. [ ] Deploy observability stack
5. [ ] Implement security controls
6. [ ] Set up CI/CD pipelines
7. [ ] Configure auto-scaling policies
8. [ ] Implement disaster recovery
9. [ ] Set up cost monitoring
10. [ ] Create operational runbooks

## üë• Team Requirements
- **Platform Lead**: Senior K8s architect
- **SRE Engineers**: 3 FTE
- **Security Engineers**: 2 FTE
- **Database Engineers**: 2 FTE
- **On-call rotation**: 24/7 coverage

## üè∑Ô∏è Labels
- infrastructure
- kubernetes
- high-priority
- platform
- scalability

## üìÖ Timeline
**Phase 1**: Weeks 1-4 (Development environment)
**Phase 2**: Weeks 5-8 (Staging environment)
**Phase 3**: Weeks 9-12 (Production environment)
**Full Production**: Q2 2025

recent_issues.title: üõ†Ô∏è Developer Experience Platform - Unified CLI, SDK, and DevTools
recent_issues.body:
## üéØ Mission
Create a world-class developer experience platform that enables rapid development, testing, and deployment of AI agents and workflows across the unified orchestration ecosystem.

## üí° Vision
Empower developers to build, test, and deploy AI solutions in minutes, not months, with comprehensive tooling, intelligent assistance, and seamless integration across all platform components.

## üèóÔ∏è Platform Components

### 1. Orchestrix CLI - Unified Command Center
```bash
# Installation
npm install -g @orchestrix/cli
# or
brew install orchestrix-cli

# Core Commands
orchestrix init <project-name>        # Initialize new project
orchestrix agent create <agent-name>  # Create new agent
orchestrix workflow generate          # Generate workflow from description
orchestrix deploy <environment>       # Deploy to environment
orchestrix test --coverage            # Run tests with coverage
orchestrix simulate <scenario>        # Simulate agent interactions
orchestrix monitor <agent-id>         # Real-time agent monitoring
orchestrix rollback <version>         # Rollback deployment

# Agent Development
orchestrix agent:create --template=<template> --name=<name>
orchestrix agent:test <agent-name> --scenario=<file>
orchestrix agent:debug <agent-name> --breakpoint=<line>
orchestrix agent:deploy <agent-name> --env=<environment>
orchestrix agent:metrics <agent-name> --period=<time>

# Workflow Management
orchestrix workflow:create --interactive
orchestrix workflow:validate <workflow-file>
orchestrix workflow:run <workflow-id> --params=<json>
orchestrix workflow:monitor <execution-id>
orchestrix workflow:optimize <workflow-id>

# Platform Management
orchestrix config set <key> <value>
orchestrix auth login
orchestrix logs tail <service> --follow
orchestrix cost analyze --period=month
orchestrix health check --all
```

### 2. SDK Libraries - Multi-Language Support

#### TypeScript/JavaScript SDK
```typescript
import { OrchestrixClient, Agent, Workflow } from '@orchestrix/sdk';

const client = new OrchestrixClient({
  apiKey: process.env.ORCHESTRIX_API_KEY,
  environment: 'production'
});

// Create and deploy an agent
class CustomAgent extends Agent {
  constructor() {
    super({
      name: 'CustomAnalyzer',
      capabilities: ['data-analysis', 'reporting'],
      authority: 6
    });
  }
  
  async execute(context: Context): Promise<Result> {
    // Agent logic
    const data = await this.analyze(context.input);
    return this.createReport(data);
  }
}

// Define a workflow
const workflow = new Workflow({
  name: 'customer-onboarding',
  steps: [
    {
      agent: 'SALES_ORCHESTRATOR',
      action: 'validate_opportunity',
      timeout: 5000
    },
    {
      agent: 'LEGAL_ADVISOR',
      action: 'review_contracts',
      parallel: true
    },
    {
      agent: 'SUCCESS_CATALYST',
      action: 'create_success_plan',
      condition: (prev) => prev.status === 'approved'
    }
  ]
});

// Execute workflow
const result = await client.workflows.execute(workflow, {
  customerId: '12345',
  tier: 'enterprise'
});
```

#### Python SDK
```python
from orchestrix import Client, Agent, Workflow
import asyncio

client = Client(
    api_key=os.environ['ORCHESTRIX_API_KEY'],
    environment='production'
)

# Create custom agent
@client.agent(
    name="DataProcessor",
    capabilities=["etl", "validation"],
    authority=5
)
async def process_data(context):
    """Process and validate incoming data"""
    data = await context.fetch_data()
    validated = await validate(data)
    return await transform(validated)

# Define workflow
workflow = Workflow(
    name="data-pipeline",
    agents=[
        ("DataProcessor", "extract"),
        ("QUALITY_GUARDIAN", "validate"),
        ("DATA_ORCHESTRATOR", "load")
    ],
    error_handler=lambda e: client.alert(e)
)

# Execute
result = asyncio.run(client.execute_workflow(workflow, params))
```

### 3. Development Environment

#### VS Code Extension
```json
{
  "name": "orchestrix-vscode",
  "features": [
    "Syntax highlighting for .agent and .workflow files",
    "IntelliSense for agent capabilities",
    "Real-time agent validation",
    "Integrated debugging",
    "Performance profiling",
    "One-click deployment",
    "Live agent monitoring",
    "Cost estimation"
  ]
}
```

#### JetBrains Plugin
```kotlin
class OrchestrixPlugin : Plugin {
  features = listOf(
    "Agent template generation",
    "Workflow visualization",
    "Real-time collaboration",
    "AI-powered code completion",
    "Integrated testing framework",
    "Performance analytics"
  )
}
```

### 4. Local Development Stack

#### Docker Compose Setup
```yaml
version: '3.8'
services:
  orchestrix-api:
    image: orchestrix/api:latest
    ports:
      - "8080:8080"
    environment:
      - ENV=development
      - DEBUG=true
  
  agent-runtime:
    image: orchestrix/agent-runtime:latest
    ports:
      - "9090:9090"
    volumes:
      - ./agents:/app/agents
      - ./workflows:/app/workflows
  
  postgres:
    image: postgres:15
    environment:
      POSTGRES_DB: orchestrix
      POSTGRES_USER: developer
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: localdev
  
  redis:
    image: redis:7-alpine
    ports:
      - "6379:6379"
  
  localstack:
    image: localstack/localstack
    environment:
      - SERVICES=s3,sqs,lambda
    ports:
      - "4566:4566"
```

### 5. Testing Framework

#### Agent Testing
```typescript
import { AgentTestHarness } from '@orchestrix/testing';

describe('CustomerSupportAgent', () => {
  let harness: AgentTestHarness;
  
  beforeEach(() => {
    harness = new AgentTestHarness({
      agent: 'SUPPORT_MAESTRO',
      mockDependencies: true
    });
  });
  
  test('should handle customer inquiry', async () => {
    const result = await harness.execute({
      input: { type: 'billing', customerId: '123' },
      expectedOutput: { resolution: 'resolved', satisfaction: 0.9 },
      timeout: 5000
    });
    
    expect(result.success).toBe(true);
    expect(result.metrics.responseTime).toBeLessThan(1000);
  });
  
  test('should coordinate with other agents', async () => {
    const simulation = await harness.simulateWorkflow({
      scenario: 'escalation',
      agents: ['SUPPORT_MAESTRO', 'TECHNICAL_ORCHESTRATOR'],
      validateInteractions: true
    });
    
    expect(simulation.interactions).toHaveLength(3);
    expect(simulation.outcome).toBe('resolved');
  });
});
```

#### Integration Testing
```python
import pytest
from orchestrix.testing import IntegrationTest

@pytest.mark.integration
class TestCustomerOnboarding(IntegrationTest):
    def test_end_to_end_onboarding(self):
        # Start workflow
        workflow = self.client.start_workflow(
            'customer-onboarding',
            params={'customer_type': 'enterprise'}
        )
        
        # Verify agent interactions
        assert workflow.wait_for_agent('SALES_ORCHESTRATOR')
        assert workflow.wait_for_agent('LEGAL_ADVISOR')
        
        # Check final state
        result = workflow.wait_for_completion(timeout=30)
        assert result.status == 'completed'
        assert result.customer_provisioned == True
```

### 6. Developer Portal

#### Interactive Documentation
```yaml
portal:
  url: https://developers.orchestrix.ai
  features:
    - interactive_api_explorer
    - code_playground
    - agent_marketplace
    - workflow_templates
    - tutorial_system
    - community_forum
    - support_chat
  
  content:
    - getting_started:
        - quickstart_guide
        - authentication
        - first_agent
        - first_workflow
    
    - api_reference:
        - rest_api
        - graphql_api
        - websocket_api
        - sdk_documentation
    
    - guides:
        - agent_development
        - workflow_design
        - testing_strategies
        - deployment_best_practices
        - performance_optimization
    
    - examples:
        - sample_agents
        - workflow_patterns
        - integration_examples
        - industry_solutions
```

### 7. AI-Powered Development Assistant

```typescript
interface DevelopmentAssistant {
  // Code generation
  generateAgent(description: string): AgentCode;
  generateWorkflow(requirements: string): WorkflowDefinition;
  
  // Code review
  reviewCode(code: string): ReviewResult;
  suggestOptimizations(code: string): Optimization[];
  
  // Debugging assistance
  analyzeError(error: Error, context: Context): Solution;
  suggestFix(issue: Issue): CodeFix[];
  
  // Performance optimization
  profilePerformance(agentId: string): PerformanceReport;
  suggestScalingStrategy(metrics: Metrics): ScalingPlan;
  
  // Documentation
  generateDocumentation(code: string): Documentation;
  createTestCases(agent: Agent): TestSuite;
}
```

## üìä Developer Metrics & Analytics

### Dashboard Components
```yaml
metrics:
  development:
    - build_time
    - test_coverage
    - code_quality_score
    - deployment_frequency
    - rollback_rate
  
  runtime:
    - agent_performance
    - workflow_execution_time
    - error_rates
    - resource_utilization
    - cost_per_execution
  
  adoption:
    - active_developers
    - api_calls_per_day
    - sdk_downloads
    - community_engagement
    - support_tickets
```

## üéØ Success Metrics

## üí∞ Investment & ROI

recent_issues.title: üìä Business Intelligence Integration - Executive Analytics & KPI Platform
üöÄ Public Platform Launch - Marketing Website, Developer Portal & Mobile Apps
üéØ Epic: Analytics Dashboard & Admin Web UI Implementation
recent_issues.body:
# üéØ Epic: Analytics Dashboard & Admin Web UI Implementation

## üåü **Vision Statement**
Transform the CLI-based Local Business Intelligence System into a stunning, enterprise-grade web platform with real-time analytics, beautiful visualizations, and powerful administrative controls.

## üìä **Current System Foundation** ‚úÖ
- **Production-Ready**: 80%+ success rate, <30s intelligence cycles  
- **Advanced Scraping**: Anti-bot evasion with Playwright integration
- **High-Quality Data**: 25+ entities per cycle with 80%+ confidence
- **Robust Backend**: 8,000+ lines of FastAPI with real-time capabilities
- **Comprehensive Testing**: 6 specialized test suites with quality gates

## üé® **Web UI Architecture Designed**

### **Frontend Stack** 
```typescript
React 18 + TypeScript + Vite
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ UI Framework: shadcn/ui + Tailwind CSS
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ State Management: Zustand + React Query
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Visualizations: Recharts + D3.js
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Maps: Leaflet for geographic intelligence
```
